entry.definition: Internal stress of the unit cell.

description.h:div:
Stress is specified as a 3x3 matrix, by definition symmetric; it is laid out in the form: xx xy xz xy yy yz xz yz zz given axes x y z. 'Internal stress', in this context, could be either internally generated or externally applied; it is most commonly encountered in the context of minimization of energy of the system with variable lattice parameters at fixed external pressure.
Note that in Golem terms this is *not* a symmetric matrix, in that it is specified in full as 3x3 - not as the upper diagonal.

description.h:div: It should be noted that total energies in DFT calculations are relative rather than absolute, and thus as such have no intrinsic meaning in and of themselves; rather, they only have meaning when considered in comparison to atomically-equivalent systems calculated at the same precision (plane-wave cutoff, k-grid, etcetera).

entry.definition: Concept which only occurs once in a document

description.h:p: Absolutely-positioned concepts occur exactly once in a document, and therefore do not need to be located by specifying a given grouping concept (or chain of grouping concepts).

entry.definition: Concept which may occur many times in a document

description.h:p: Relatively-positioned concepts can occur more than once in a document, and therefore need to be located by specifying a given grouping concept (or chain of grouping concepts).

entry.definition: Concept acting as a container for other concepts

description.h:p: Grouping concepts do not directly contain values; instead, they contain other, relatively positioned, concepts, which themselves may or may not contain values.

entry.definition: Concept with a direct payload of data

description.h:p: Value-bearing concepts directly contain observables - data with a value we can extract and evaluate.

entry.definition: User-specified input parameters for the simulation.
User-specified input parameters with defined transforms to code-native input.
A concept appearing the final properties of a task.

INTERNAL ENTRY for golem web tool use

entry.definition: Concept which only occurs once in a document

description.h:p: Absolutely-positioned concepts occur exactly once in a document, and therefore do not need to be located by specifying a given grouping concept (or chain of grouping concepts).

entry.definition: Concept which may occur many times in a document

description.h:p: Relatively-positioned concepts can occur more than once in a document, and therefore need to be located by specifying a given grouping concept (or chain of grouping concepts).

entry.definition: Concept acting as a container for other concepts

description.h:p: Grouping concepts do not directly contain values; instead, they contain other, relatively positioned, concepts, which themselves may or may not contain values.

entry.definition: Concept with a direct payload of data

description.h:p: Value-bearing concepts directly contain observables - data with a value we can extract and evaluate.

entry.definition: User-specified input parameters for the simulation.
A concept appearing the final properties of a task.

description.h:p: The value of the heat capacity obtained from the variance of the energy divided by the square of the temperature, as per the usual definition for the canonical ensemble. Units are set to be dimensionless because we have defined temperature in units of energy, and we set Boltzmann's constant to equal 1 with no units.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']/cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:HeatCapacity']

description.h:p: An array of length Number of Sites, with an element for each site. For a cold start, the value of each element of this array specifies the number of the type of atom (ranging from 1 to the Number of Species).

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:initialModule']/cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:ColdPattern']

description.h:p: Number of different type of atomic species involved in the ordering processes.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:NumberOfSpecies']

description.h:p: The set temperature is used to control the Metropolis Monte Carlo algorithm. Denoting E as the change in energy associated with a proposed change in the configuration, the change is accepted if E is negative. Otherwisee the proposed change is accepted with probability given by exp(-E/T), where T is the set temperature. The units of temperature are the same as the units of the exchange parameters, and OSSIA has no units-specific dependency.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:temperature']

description.h:p: Module to contain information about the state of the initial system.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:initialModule']

entry.definition: Instantaneous value of the energy of the configuration

description.h:p: The energy of the configuration, with units as specified for the exchange interaction (eV by default).

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:energy']

description.h:p: Total number of ordering sites (called spins) in the sample.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:NumberOfSpins']

entry.definition: Rate of sampling configurations for average quantities

description.h:p: Because there is a cost associated with computing average quantities, and because sequential configurations are correlated, OSSIA samples configurations for average quantities over pre-set intervals, as set by this parameter.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:SampleRate']

description.h:p: The exchange energy is defined according to the relation that an energy associated with two neighbouring sites is given as E = JS(1)S(2), where J is the exchange energy, and S(1) and S(2) are variables that describe the occupancy of two atomic sites. Typically S will have value of 0 or 1. We arbitrarily associate the units of eV, although since everything is defined in the same unit terms (including temperature) this is not important for the running of the simulation.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:Jmax']

entry.definition: Module for final properties and configuration

description.h:p: Module to hold the final properties and configuration.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']

entry.term: First PDF value for first atom types
entry.definition: First-neighbour PDF value for first atom types

description.h:p: First-neighbour pair distribution function value for first atom types.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']/cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:PDF1']

description.h:p: Time taken for the simulation, units of seconds.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']/cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:runtime']

description.h:p: A matrix giving the partial pair distribution function for all neighbours that interact in the sample Hamiltonian.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']/cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:PDF']

description.h:p: Number of atomic sites in the repeating unit.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:NumberOfSites']

description.h:p: Inverse of the susceptibility.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']/cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:Stiffness']

entry.definition: Mean value of the energy squared.

description.h:p: Mean value of the square of the energy of the system, averaged over all analysis configurations.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']/cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:EnergySquared']

description.h:p: Ossia works with two models for the interactions between atoms, and thus should have either of the following two value:

h:ol.h:li: This model associates an exchange energy defined so that that atoms of the same type are associated with an energy of +J and atoms of the opposite type are associated with an energy -J;
This model associates an exchange energy defined so that if both atoms are of one particular type the energy is +J, and zero otherwise.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:Jtype']

description.h:p: An array giving the fractional content of each of the type of atom; the number of elements is equal to the number of species, and the sum of all elements is equal to 1.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:SpeciesFractions']

entry.definition: Mean value of the square of the order parameter

description.h:p: Mean value of the square of the order parameter, averaged over all analysis configurations.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']/cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:OrderParameterSquared']

entry.definition: Value of the initial seed for the random number generator

description.h:p: Value of the initial seed for the random number generator.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:RNGseed']

description.h:p: The suseceptibility defined as the variance of the order parameter divided by the temperature, as per the usual definition for the canonical ensemble.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']/cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:Susceptibility']

entry.definition: Number of configurations generated by the Monte Carlo simulation

description.h:p: This parameter sets the number of Monte Carlo steps, or equivalently the number of configurations generated by the Monte Carlo simulation. Sequential configurations that are identical are treated as independent.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:NumberOfSteps']

description.h:p: The value of the parameter that describes the degree of long-range atomic ordering.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:OrderParameter']

entry.term: Module containing analysis for a single step
entry.definition: Module containing the analysis for a single Monte Carlo step

description.h:p: Modules contain groups of information. The analysis module contains a set of analyses for a single step through the Monte Carlo simulation.

entry.golem:xpath: /cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='ossia:analysis']

description.h:p: There are three possible ways to define the initital configuration in ossia:

h:ol.h:li: Cold start: The initial configuration has complete long-range site order as defined by the keyword cold. The positions of the different types of atoms are read in the input file as a list;
Hot start: The initial configuration is completely disordered as defined by the keyword hot. The positions of atoms are chosen at random;
Warm start: The initial configuration is ordered with respect to some atoms and disordered with respect to other, as defined by the keyword warm.

entry.golem:xpath: .//cml:parameterList/cml:parameter[@dictRef='ossia:startType']
/cml:cml/cml:module[@dictRef='emin:finalModule']/cml:propertyList/cml:property[@dictRef='ossia:Energy']

entry.definition: Number of different atomic species in the RMC configuration.

description.p: Number of different atomic species in the RMC configuration.

entry.definition: Labels for the different atoms types

description.p: Labels for the different atom types, with order consistent with the order of atoms in the configuration file.

entry.definition: Numbers of atoms of each type

description.p: Numbers of atoms of each type, in order of atoms in the configuration
Number of coordination restraints
Number of mean coordination restraints

entry.term: Number of neutron real-space data sets
entry.definition: Number of neutron real-space data sets

description.div: The energy given by Eks - Eegg. It is the responsiblity of the user to supply the fourier coefficients for the eggbox effect. The coefficients must be supplied in the fdf file in an fdf block, see the user guide for details.

entry.definition: Maximum difference in the density matrix

div.p: The maximum difference in a given element in the density matrix in two consecutive steps. The cut-off tolerance is governed by the value of MD.maxCGtol in the fdf file.
Maximum value in the difference between elements of the density matrix during the self-consistency iterations. Self-consistency is achieved when this value is smaller than the tolerance specified.

description.div: SIESTA requires internally a number to tag each species.

div.p: Defined using PAO.BasisType or %block PAO.Basis. SIESTA uses finite-ranged pseudo-atomic orbitals [1,2].
Acceptable values are split, split Gaussian, nodes, nonodes. Default value: split
1. Sankey and Niklewsky. Phys. Rev. B, 40, (1989), 3979
2. D. Sanchez-Portal, E. Artacho and J. Soler. J. Phys. Chem. Mater. , 8, (1996), 3859

description.div: Array of values, one for each angular momentum, containing, the maximum principal quantum number present for each.

entry.definition: All the electronic states below this energy are occupied, and all the energy levels above it, are empty.

description.div: An array of size 3 by (number of atoms), which describes the instantaneous forces acting upon each atom.

entry.definition: The stress tensor Τ of a system is a three by three matrix whose elements Τij represent the stress on the i plane in the j direction.
The isotropic pressure of the system. Equal to the trace of the stress tensor.
The molecular pressure of the system; equal to the total pressure minus the virial.
